page.title: 19SHEEP SHEARING
page.content: On{Tuesday 18th June 1985,}we went to {Court Green Farm}to watch some {sheep shearing.}There were 2 shepherds shearing the sheep and 2 shepherds tying up the{fleeces.}To become an {expert shearer}they have to shear over {40,000 sheep.}They have to hold the sheep in a specific way, so they dont kick and struggle and make it difficult for the shearer.On the sheeps coat there is a{greasy substance{lanolin.}This lanolin acts as a{waterproofing}to the coat of the sheep in{wet weather.}The{fleeces}are sent to {wool farm}near{Selby}where it is cleaned and spun into wool. The wool is then made into{garments.}After the sheep are sheared they are{dipped for{sheep scab,}before they are sent out into the fields to graze.
